The troops grabbed the weapons and began to fortify, unsure of what was going on. Then, over the plains, a group of humans were running from the direction of the artillery. They were almost to the gates when three huge metallic beasts lumbered over the same ground. The things looked like armored spiders, with two gun turrets mounted on the sides. Each nightmare was easily the size of a small house. The guns opened fire, blasting cannon shells towards the fleeing artillerymen. Some exploded in the rear and killed the stragglers. The rest made it safely behind the walls. One was the commander you'd talked to earlier.

"What the hell are those things?" you yelled down from the ramparts as they hastily closed the gates.

"Big. Nasty. Ugly. Other than that, I have no idea. They were spotted awhile ago, at least twenty of them. We killed some of them, but they're frighteningly fast. I give us about ten minutes before we're all dead here. The beasties are pretty immune to gas sadly." The soldier seemed mournful.

Now the spiders were firing at the walls, chunks of it giving away under the barrage. The elves advanced under the cover of the fire, but didn't have the capability to take much of the ruins. However, when anything bigger than a rifle opened fire the spiders blew it away. The clanking behemoths had been joined by several other nightmarish creations, and were right outside the wall.

"Come with me," you said to the artilleryman.

You had a can of gas and a towel. Quickly wrapping the towel around a rock, you doused it in kerosene from a ruined lamp. Handing it to the commander you instructed him.

"Throw this right after me."

You popped the can of gas and chucked it at the spider rooting through the town right next to you. It lodged in its maw, and it popped it open with its mandibles and teeth. A cloud of yellow gas erupted from the ruptured can. The soldier lit the towel with a match, and hurled it at the same spot you had. The gas was highly flammable, as evidenced by the explosions earlier. The cloud that had been covering the monster's face burst into a sheet of fire, making it rear back in agony. It clawed at its face, and howled in a strange scream. A soldier with a new grenade launcher thought quickly shot a round into the mouth. The ensuing explosion caused it more pain, and another launcher sent a gas round down its throat. Now that the noxious fumes were inside its defenses, they worked as intended and it toppled over dead. Elves popped out of turrets and other apparatus on the beast. Some made it to cover, others were hacked down by gunfire.
15512111112212111222111222.title: You have been completely cut off, and are surro...

choices: The elves try something
The elves pull back
155121111122121112221112221.content:
For a moment, the spiders and their drivers pulled back, stunned that one of them could have been taken down. You used the brief respite to organize your survivors. About 25% had been killed or captured in the last round of fighting, and many of your machine guns were down. With a little over 1500 men you fell back a little into the denser ruins and began to set up defensive positions. The elves would be back to finish you off, no doubt.

Just as the surviving machine guns had been set up, the elves rushed the humans. Two spiders walked ahead of the infantry. They laid down cannon fire and machine gun barrages all over, trying to figure out where your men were concealed. Finally the enemy got to within 200 yards. Guns barked and elves fell, the charge quickly losing steam. Some of the soldiers in the trenches fell, stricken by arrows or bullets. The spiders began to close in. They couldn't come as far into the wreckage as you could, but from a distance they were still lethal. As a new trick, one opened its maw and unleashed a wave of fire.

"Fall back! Retreat!" You jumped from the trenches and moved to a position farther back.

You turned to cover the other soldiers while they moved back. Then you were running again. The wound from earlier hurt under the panic and the strain. Maybe Amber had finally gotten you. All it took was one victory, even though the other campaigns had been advancing so well. Cursing the town, you fired a round at an elf. You missed, and he turned to shoot you. You worked the bolt on your gun, but it jammed. Too late to dive for cover, this was the end. You were doomed to be violated by a-CRACK

The gunshot came from your right. The elf crumpled, a stain spreading over its chest. Then time slowed to normal speed again, and you realized that a second hadn't even passed since the jammed bolt and the dead elf. Someone was talking in your ear.

"Move you fool, do you want to end up like him?" In a daze, you followed the soldier.

The troops were running towards the citadel, a relic from wars fought with swords and arrows. Now that the heaviest weapons effectively used would be your machine guns, it would still be a good stronghold. When you ran through the doors, they slammed shut behind you.

"Thank you, you have no idea how thankful I am. I'm the king, who are you?" you babbled to the soldier who saved you.

You looked closer at him now. He was somewhat older, his hair graying. A small but noticeable scar ran up his cheek. He had a fur coat with black leather shielding him from the cold of fall. His eyes had a gleam similar to Schmidt's, but less obvious, more like a hawk about to swoop on an unsuspecting mouse

"Thorvald. Heinz Thorvald." his voice also had an edge to it. "Sniper. And you're lucky there was only the one. I don't fancy sticking my neck out when not necessary. Even if you're a king." And thus ended your first discussion with Thorvald.

Over the next few days, you would accompany him on his sniping trips and meeting his fellow squad mates. It helped pass the boredom of waiting for an elf attack, and you picked up some tricks about sniping, and a gleaming new scope. The first lesson you learned happened when an elf sniper almost took you out, spotting you by the glare off the scope. From then on, cloth muted the colors of the scope.
155121111122121112221112221.title: Elf infantry tries seizing the ruins

choices: Ask about the giant leaps in technology
Push forward from this position
1551211111221211122211122211.content:
Today was a normal day, a week into the siege of the fortress. Your troops were beginning to run low on food, although a reservoir kept everyone from being thirsty. Ammunition was also threatening to be a problem. But it was also a good day for your sniper team. The more experienced sniper you shadowed had killed three elven officers, and it was only noon. You hadn't shot, only spotted and stood watch. This afternoon, the roles would reverse. It was important to keep the elves from feeling safe in their own trenches. They were building up troop strength inside the ruins, and would eventually overwhelm you. But demoralizing them and killing their leaders would make that harder for them.

"You never want to be in the same space twice when shooting. That is a definite way to get riddled with bullets. And we need every man in this ruin," The sniper had a British accent which was strange because the virtual Britain was under Amber's control. You asked about it.

"Well, a while ago they just stormed out of the woods. Our militias and armies fought them over every inch, but it was just too much. Many of us fled here. The ones who didn't got massacred or enslaved. That was before we had beauties like this one here." he looked at his rifle happily. "And I'm going to go back there soon. I will personally burn ten villages for every one of my family members I don't find. This stuff here is just a warmup. Hello, what's this?"

He looked through the scope of the rifle. Following it with your binoculars you noticed a form on the horizon. Then, it separated into three different forms, which rapidly grew larger.

"My god, those are armored dragons I believe. We now have two options open to us my liege. Surrender or die."

An elf with a captain's crest began to tenderly advance with a squad. The sniper shot him in the head, making a neat hole above his eyes.

"Damn, a little to the left. Well, let's relocate."

The flapping of leathery wings was growing louder, along with the screeches of the dragons. Not a moment after you began to descend the battered staircase flames boiled through the windows. You would have been deep-fried if you'd waited one more second. At the bottom of the stairs Thorvald and a surviving artilleryman awaited you. The British sniper saluted and walked off.

"Well, we're well and truly screwed now. It won't be too easy hitting those with anything that'll hurt em. I'm willing to fight, but I'll surrender if I have to." the gunner said.

Thorvald nodded agreement. You wanted to fight, you would die either way if Amber got a hold on you. This decision puzzled you. Maybe they wouldn't recognize you if you surrendured. Then again, maybe they would. Emphasizing that time was not on your side, loud booms echoed through the halls.

"Going after the door. Well, I'm gonna go drop some grenades on them." The artilleryman walked off.

Thorvald left after. You went to join the emplacements behind the door, ready to repel whatever forces the elves threw at you. Even running, it took a good five minutes to get to the door. It was beginning to splinter and bulge inward. You could hear the spiders hissing, the dragons howling, and the elves cheering. Quietly, you could hear another sound. It was just background noise, but it was getting steadily louder. The banging on the doors ceased, and cheers turned to alarmed shouts. You could hear the dragons and spider shifting.

The noise was now very loud, and getting even louder. It reached a terrifying shrieking noise for a moment, and a short burst of gunfire rattled through the walls. A louder burst answered and the shrieking passed. Now you could distinctly hear at least six similar sounds. They grew in intensity too, although at slightly different pitches. More deep bursts of firing sounded outside, and a stream of holes punched through the thick doors. Adjusting your grip on the rifles, you nervously wiped the sweat off your brow. The elves were screaming outside now, after the latest pass by the shriekers caused a loud explosion the dragons were calling out in what could have been worry, whatever guns they had on them firing rapidly.

Now audible was a clanking noise. More explosions, and then the beat of wings. The dragons were leaving the elves undefended. But why? The answer came crashing through the door the next instant. A huge blast shattered the door. You ducked behind the sandbags like everyone else to avoid large splinters. Then the sounds of battle grew louder. Raising your head, you stared out in awe. A line of tanks was advancing on the elves.

A spider and a dragon were dead, horribly mutilated. Two more were flying towards this new threat. Then the shrieks came again, and three jets flew by overhead. They looked like some prototype planes you'd seen in a WWII documentary a while ago. They all had a large cannon mounted on their noses, complemented by four smaller cannons. They strafed the ground troops, sending columns of dirt fountaining into the air. You wondered why they weren't taking out the aerial threat.

Then four more planes flew over. These were delta shaped, and looked faster and more maneuverable than the ones murdering the ground elves. They broke off in pairs, each pair circling in on a dragon. Like predatory birds, they dove on their targets guns blazing. The dragons howled in pain, but stayed aloft. Battered and broken, they tried to fly off. Then one of the other planes with the cannon broke off the ground run and blasted away at the dragon. The beast seemed to come apart under the guns of the deadly plane, chunks of meat being torn off. The plane fired a shot at the neck, and it separated completely from the body.

The tanks were rolling on, mostly unimpeded by the wreckage. The elves fired everything they could at the behemoths, but their thick armor shed the bullets, balls, and arrows like rain. The chattering of their machine guns and the booms of their 88 and 75 mm guns sent the elves blindly running. The more organized groups sent up white flags. You stood and stared in awe. A group of elves stood and walked toward your position, hands high in surrender. A tank reared out of the rubble behind them. A soldier on the machine gun mowed them down ruthlessly.

"They burned Haven! No survivors, all the civilians lined up and shot. Then burned. No mercy!" The turret gunner called.

You didn't know Haven, but from the way the soldiers reacted it was fairly well known. The elves were basically crushed at this point. Some groups got lucky and surrendered to units who didn't execute them. Other weren't so fortunate. You spotted one of your generals and walked over to discuss the situation with him
1551211111221211122211122211.title: The elves try something

choices: A helicopter. Schmidt's back!
Waves. You've reached the coast!
15512111112212111222111222112.content:
Then you decided that the explanations for the advances could wait, and that you needed to catch up with the rest of the assault. They were probably farther ahead if they had received these weapons earlier than you had.

"Come on! Let's make the elves sorry they set foot on this continent!" You called.

Some soldiers cheered, and hopped on the waiting tanks. Several half-tracks had reached the lines. These took on more of your troops, and the mechanized advance began again. Quickly, the ruins fell behind while your tanks rushed forward. Not half an hour later, the armor found survivors of a different skirmish. They were humans, but were badly beaten. There were five tanks and three battered half-tracks. One was down for repairs, and had delayed their return to human lines.

"Hey there, you have anyone who know how to fix this?" A trooper called.

The driver of the tank you had hitched a ride on responded "Get one of the tanks to tow it, we don't have enough mechanics, I think they're called, with us. There's only a few per battalion, the most that could be pulled away from the factory."

This was interesting. Only one factory churned out the vehicles. 100 dollars to guess whose factory that was.

"What happened to the rest of your company?"

"We got ambushed by some of those Nightmares. Eight-legged freaks blend into the forest too well. Then some dragons turned our retreat into a stampede. Hopefully, the elves won't get too much stuff outta the hardware we left."

"How far away did you get hit? Maybe we could root those bastards out. I hear that the command car's got a radio, the commander could call for some planes. Then they wouldn't have a prayer." The tank man said grimly.

The column stopped for an hour while the commander worked out airstrikes on the forest. Then the squad leaders came out and began to organize the remnants of your battalion into this new force. You got placed into a heavy half-track, this one fitted with a light artillery cannon in place of the usual .50 machine gun. In addition to your rifle, you were given an SMG. A brief instruction course told you that it was better for up-close fighting, as it was not accurate over long ranges. Not entirely sure how to work the gun, you stuck to your rifle. A rumble of a diesel engine starting announced the start of the assault.

It wasn't as dark in the troop transport as it was in the fortress, thanks to firing slits in the armor. From a ways away, you could see some jets firebombing a pristine forest. A huge spider, or Nightmare as you had discovered they were called, reared up out of the trees and charged for open plains. One of the machine guns on it's back got lucky and started a fire in one of the jets. It climbed, and a shape fell away from it. Then, it turned and dove for the earth. As it blossomed into a beautiful fireball a parachute opened in the air.

A noise like the end of the world came from your half-track, and you thought you'd been hit. Then you remembered the gun turret above you. There was an explosion on the side of the Nightmare. One of its cannon turrets was destroyed, but the other one fired at a tank. The round either struck a glancing blow or was too weak to harm it, as it flew off the side in a shower of sparks. Rotating, it fired again. This time, a tank did explode as the round hit it in the engine compartment. The rest of the column had closed to within range of the mighty beast, and began to blast it. Even outnumbered, it refused to go down without a fight. Another tank was destroyed and one was disabled before the Nightmare let out a wounded bellow and collapsed to the ground. White flags flew from open cupolas on the emplacements. This time, the soldier took all those who surrendered.

Your squad was approaching a closed hatch. There were noises inside, very ominous. Grabbing your SMG, you grabbed the latch. Two soldiers stood on either side of you, rifles aimed into the opening. You swung it back, jumping behind it to shield you from and projectiles. Your caution payed off. Several bullets and arrows zinged out. A few caught you in the legs, making you collapse in pain. You brought up your SMG and hosed the inside down. One of the soldiers was down, clutching at a chest wound. The other was fiddling with something.

"Bombs away!" He tossed a grenade inside, swinging the hatch shut behind it. A muffled explosion went off, and smoke wafted out. Leaning on your rifle, you pulled the hatch open again. The smell of roasting meat greeted you. This battle was won. Limping back to a field hospital, you told the medics where your wounded squad mate was. You got your injuries treated. Thanks to your magic, they healed much faster.

While you lay on your cot, you heard an unmistakable sound that brought a smile to your face.
15512111112212111222111222112.title: Push forward from this position

choices: During the invasion
Invasion successful, now on the Island campaign
155121111122121112221112221122.content:
Overhead, seagulls cried and wheeled about. They came back fast after the fighting ended. Then it occurred to you what they'd be eating. You tried not to be sick. Luckily, you got to the latrines before you failed at trying. All the while, you were overjoyed your forces had reached the coast.

Back in the capital city, now well behind the lines, you looked at the map. Most of it was a reassuring blue, with the island off the coast still red. Some other pockets of red persisted on the main continent, but those were surrounded by figurines representing tanks and infantry. They wouldn't stay red for long.

Upon your return from the front, you had been told at a meeting of your commanders that they had been notified of a massive factory complex high in the mountains. Inside was a cornucopia of weapons of death. The workers at the factory had been expecting the units to move in, and were training new workers and mechanics in the art of repairing the vehicles and weapons churned out. Based on the schematics at the first site, more factories were being established closer to rail hubs. No one but you had any clue on who was responsible for the factory.

After the meeting was over, you looked out at the city below. It had changed, with the train station getting larger, the guns on the walls getting smaller but more powerful. The soldiers were no longer armored knights, but rifle and machine-gun bearing infantry. Roads and highways branched out to other cities and towns, making the heavy trucks carrying things all across the kingdom more useful. Behind you, you heard something click shut.

"I was wondering when you'd come and explain to me what you're doing Schmidt. It has been a while since you deigned to tell me what was going on in that shadowy mind of yours." You pictured him smiling that sinister smile.

"Well my king, you might be more thankful to me for helping you make such huge advances on Amber's forces. It is no small feat that I can keep making these developments at such rapid paces, especially when my factories keep getting hijacked."

"Why don't you just work normally, like everyone else. This is a somewhat straightforward ga-...scenario." You stopped.

You didn't know whether these A.I. were given a sense of whether they lived in a computer or not. You didn't want to make a powerful A.I. with an existential crisis right as you were about to crush Amber.

"This game? Yes I know none of this is real. Some of my fellow A.I. may not realize this, but I am all too painfully aware of this fact. I am a protection program, meant to do what is best for the people of this world. At any costs. And right now, this means winning the current war so I may advance to grander designs." With an internal sigh of relief, you discovered Schmidt wasn't as good an A.I. as he considered himself.

After the war was won, the simulation would shut down until needed again. But from there, he discussed his inventions and their proper deployments more than his purpose in the game.
155121111122121112221112221122.title: Waves. You've reached the coast!

choices: Go right, personal safety
Go left, save a life
1551211111221211122211122211221.content:
"Alright fellas, this is it! One last push, and the elves fall like a house of cards! We hit the beach in five minutes. Each man spread out, don't get too close or the MGs will tear you apart. Keep the sand outta your actions. There are those that'll die here, and those that'll die later. If you don't make it off, this is a Hell of a good place to die!" the captain concluded his speech.

You wanted to be sick. The waves rolling the craft like a bath toy were like someone repeatedly punching your stomach. A jet streaked by overhead, followed by two more. Guns blazing, they strafed the lines of pillboxes guarding the beaches from the armies of man. Chunks of masonry flew off, but the guns inside kept firing at troops already on the beach. You were part of the second wave of troops landing.

A whistle blew, and the ramp dropped. Three men ahead of you jerked and spasmed, torn up by guns. You dove out of the landing craft and into the water. There was an unexpected drop. You felt yourself sinking, drowning while bullets zipped though the water all around you. The water had a red tinge to it already. Then your feet touched the bottom, and you forced yourself to move forward and upward through the blackness clouding your mind. Your lungs were about to explode. Your vision was turning black. Lights were fading.

Your head burst through the water, and you gasped in lungfuls of air. Your senses returned. Striking out for the nearest cover, a hole about twenty yards away, you looked around to see how many men made it. Not enough. Nonetheless, you moved to the hole, determined to survive. Jumping into the hole just before the machine gun bullets kicking up dirt towards you, you looked up towards the bunker covering this stretch of beach.

The SMG on your back wasn't accurate enough to reach the bunker and do any damage. You had to get closer. The next hole was too far away to get to safely. However a burned out tank a little closer might do. You fired a burst from your gun in the hopes of making the gunners get down for a moment. Then you took off like a bullet from your gun. You ducked and weaved, trying to make it harder for the elves to get a shot at you. Behind you, you heard bullets hitting the dirt. Then you were thrown forward for no reason. You felt several white-hot points of heat in your chest, but those dulled and faded to the cold numbness you felt everywhere else.

'I've been shot' you thought.

You were so close. Would it count as Amber's victory if you died, but your army won the war? Another few rounds from the machine gun cruelly raked your body. One you felt tear through your cheekbones and jaw.

'Will they even recognize me if they find me?'

For the second time in as many minutes, the lights were going out. Then you recalled something from early on. The advancing technology had almost made you forget about your magic! Your wounds were pretty severe, but you'd been stockpiling it for a few years. You concentrated, feeling a warm buzz restore feeling to your fingers. It was like reverse frostbite, with feeling returning to your extremities and flowing into your core. A minute later, you felt fine. Not wasting time, you ran the rest of the way towards the tank. This time the guns left you alone, seeking other targets. Now that a moment of peace had been given to you, you felt your face. It seemed whole enough. But back on the sand behind you was a huge puddle of your blood, bones from your face, and your left foot. You wiggled your toes, making sure they were still there.

Now assessing your tactical situation, you saw you weren't the farthest advanced soldier. Groups were ahead of you and behind you, along with single soldiers like yourself. You needed to advance, get close enough to hit the bunkers. On your right was the crater you'd been aiming for. To the left, there was a thick concrete barricade to keep tanks from advancing. It was a little farther away, but there was a wounded soldier lying there, calling out. The medics were preoccupied, and he seemed too far gone anyway. But you might have enough magic left to save two lives now. Which way to go?
1551211111221211122211122211221.title: During the invasion

choices: Secure some port cities to begin to move in heavier weapons
Push deeper, taking advantage of the elves' disarray
15512111112212111222111222112212.content:
In your mind, it wasn't even a contest. The second you saw the injured soldier, you knew what you had to do. You grabbed your weapon from the sand and prepared to run for the downed trooper. Then, overhead, you heard the roar of a plane. It flew by almost as low as your head and strafed the bunker with its huge cannon. One must have struck the gunner, as the machine gun stopped chattering.

Seizing the opportunity, you ran forward before other guns could cover the holes left by the the destruction of this one. You scooped up the soldier and made it to the tank traps. He was obviously seconds from death, but you lay your hands on him, not sure if your magic could heal others. A blue aura shone from your palms, washing over his body. The wounds began to close and heal over, and the color returned to his skin. Thirty seconds later he was as good as new, but disoriented.

"Stay here! Whatever happens, don't move. You're safe here. Get a medic as soon as possible," you told the dazed trooper. He nodded.

Then, you continued to advance up the beaches. After a few more close calls, you reached the bunker that had been strafed by the fighter. The door to the structure was thick steel and locked tight. The guns inside weren't firing, so the elves inside could wait. Up ahead, a squad of elves were moving up.

"Elves twelve o'clock!" A voice from behind called out.

Two soldiers jumped into a hole besides you. The three of you fired at the elves. They fell, wounded or taking cover.

"Cover me, I'm going to flank them." You crawled off along a battered trench.

Behind the elves was a convenient stack of boxes. The two infantrymen fired from a semi-automatic rifle like a Gewher-43 or M1 Garand., and a heavier assault rifle like an FG-42. The elves mostly kept their heads down, but occasionally fired off a few shots. So far none of them had noticed you approach. You were almost to your cover when one spotted you moving. It turned, calling to his squad mates. A hail of bullets flurried past you, none striking you. In a desperate dive, you made it back to the trenches. The elves were caught between you and the two soldiers in the crater, but you were not in an ideal spot.

A grenade sailed into the trench. Your eyes almost popped out of your head. Your arms moved without conscious thought. The grenade was beside you, then in your clenched fists, then flying back towards the elves. A burst of light an odd blue color and a sound unlike a normal grenade almost drew you out of hiding. Quickly catching yourself, you peeked out of a firing slit in the boards. An odd, sparkly blue mist was shining over the elves. One stood up, swatting at his arms and legs. The stuff seemed to stick to him, and his flailing only drew the cloud to him faster like a sentient being.

He was screaming horribly, and it became obvious that the stuff was very hot. Some others stood up and were chopped down by bullets. The others came out with raised palms, and were taken to the medics who had moved into the bunker. It had been secured while you were fighting these elves. More men were pushing onto the island through this breach. Others bunkers were cut off, and quickly fell. By the end of two hellish days, the full stretch of beach was in human hands.
15512111112212111222111222112212.title: No one left behind

choices: Masters of Orion - Galactic Civilization Game.
Space Wars!  Its ships and building ships and more ships!!
15512112.content:
Science fiction it is!

There are two types of possible Science Fiction grand strategic games.

1: Masters of Orion style Star Spanning Empire game. You pick a civilization, you pick how your society advances with technology and you design the ships themselves.

2. Its a war with two sides. Both sides have ships and production facilities and is a militaristic strategy game as opposed to an empire building strategy game.

Which type of game will Amber choose?
15512112.title: Science Fiction - Ships, Lasers and Space!

choices: Focus on quick production and combat troops!
Focus on science and technology.
155121121.content:
You pick the more strategic choice. You will construct your civilization and watch it grow from one planet to becoming a stellar empire!

The first step is to pick what kind of racial traits you would like your race to have. There were hundreds of options however two strategies revealed themselves.

You could focus your unique race that has superior reflexes, can build quicker and can fight better. It was very tempting since combat would inevitability occur between your people and Amber's.

The other option was based on scientific knowledge and cerebral prowess. This race wouldn't fight well.... but it could develop unique technologies. Building more advanced ships could be a powerful boon, not to mention the fact that if you could hold off Amber long enough you could probably develop some crazy super weapon that could turn the tide.

The choice was yours, what will you do?
155121121.title: Masters of Orion - Galactic Civilization Game.

choices: Space the final frontier!  FTL drives it is!
No we have to get production up and running!  AI and Robots!
1551211212.content:
You decide to pick a cerebral science oriented race. You are not actually on the planet you race starts. You have an overview of the universe like you were actually playing a game. However unlike a game you could zoom in and possess a particular person of your people. In this way you could get a ground view of what was going on if you wished.

The people you have are a short blue folk who live on a .8G world. This makes them unsuited for combat however this the space age! Lasers, missiles and ships are going to decide this conflict your sure.

Your race could focus on building FTL (faster then light) drives to begin exploring nearby solar systems or they could focus on build AI robotics that would allow the world to increase production, send out unmanned probes and explore the solar system. Building faster would be great... but you could run out of resources. Plus with only one world you could be vulnerable to a surprise attack if Amber found you.
1551211212.title: Focus on science and technology.

choices: Amber couldn't have found you yet, its safe to start colonizing.
Better safe then sorry.  Research lasers and shields.
15512112121.content:
You focus your race's scientific research on the creation of faster then light travel. Soon you race can reach for the stars.

The first thing is finding inhabitable planets. Unfortunately most are not! You are able to colonize a moon or two but without major terraforming you wont' be able to establish bases on other planets.

Your ships of of now are quite defenseless, still its early in the game and you doubt Amber is going to be able to hit you quite yet so you have some time. On the other hand getting some defenses and attack power for your ships would prepare you for the worst.

What should you do? Research the technology to 'terraform' planets to allow your people to spread and multiply or can that wait until you get better armed ships?
15512112121.title: Space the final frontier!  FTL drives it is!

choices: Amber has found you!  Uh Oh!
All quiet on the Amber front.
155121121211.content:
Thinking about it carefully you realize that Amber's people couldn't have started with FTL drives. If they spent time researching it they wouldn't be that combat oriented yet. It was safe to continue... you hoped.

So you have your people learn the art of transforming a planet to make it habitable. Your blue people (you decide to name them the Adronni) begin settling on dozens of worlds. No quick strike can take you out now but it could cripple your nascent empire.

Did your gamble backfire? Did Amber's people find yours? Are they going to exploit the fact you haven't built any combat ships yet?
155121121211.title: Amber couldn't have found you yet, its safe...

choices: Continue...
Suddenly Amber shuts off the game/ hacks it out of rage!
1551211212111.content:
Everything is quiet, one of your colonies has just become self sufficient, you decide to turn it into a military oriented planet as it's on the outskirts of your empire and would be the most voulnerable in case of an attack.
Just as another precautionary measure you decide to arm the space station orbiting that system's sun with armor peircing missiles and nuclear missiles, making it exceptionally well suited to fight heavily armored or capital ships.
You focus your attention on other more pressing matters for a small while when you suddenly see a small notification that a small scout ship has been spotted in the military system you beefed up otherwise known as the Sedmar system.
A few small ships you have stationed there open fire and attempt to destroy the scout but it's already too late, Amber definately knows where you are now and is likely sending a fleet over to you right now to handle the situation and invade you.
Seeing as the scout wasn't in the Sedmar system for long it likely saw that you had a station and colony there but not that it was fortified and prepared for an attack, you use this to your advantage and start moving your fleet to the system with a slight grin.

Just as you expected a few minutes later you get a notification that an enemy fleet has been spotted entering the Sedmar system, seeing as the only fleet you had stationed there was a small garrison it's quickly destroyed by Amber's advancing fleet as it heads directly towards the station unaware of what it has in store.
Amber's flagship in the middle of her fleet is the first to fire, launching two nuclear warheads towards the station, they impact with a flash but then Sedmar station returns fire launching two nuclear warheads and a multitude of armor piercing rounds straight towards Amber's flagship.
Although Sedmar station is vastly outnumbered, it refuses to surrender and in combination with it's many weapons, destroys a few ships and cripples many more including Amber's flagship starting an internal fire that eventually renders the ship unusable.
Eventually escape pods eject from the crumbling defense station and fly towards the lush green colony in the same system, although many escape pods are destroyed Sedmar station has managed to hold Amber's fleet off just long enough for your main fleet to arrive.
With Amber's flagship effectively destroyed and many of her other cruisers destroyed or damaged she has to rely heavily on the few main battleships she has left and the hundreds of smaller ships she has to make her fleet look bigger making this anything but a fair fight.

Your biggest ships open fire unleashing a torrent of red and blue lasers destroying some of the smaller ships in seconds, you then remember about.your species, their technology and by extension navies are possibly the best in the galaxy but if you were to place one of your aliens and one of Amber's in the same room Amber's would certainly win. Remembering this you realise the importance of not letting any of Amber's ships get within boarding range, as you realise this one of Amber's last remaining cruisers charges through the rest of her ships towards your lines destroying some of her ships in the process.
All of your ships focus their fire on Amber's charging cruiser and many of your smaller fighter-like ships move forwards to engage, you suddenly remember you can essentially choose to play any of your aliens that you want, you choose one flying a fighter and are instantly in the cockpit instinctively dodging lasers and missiles as you fly towards the colossal cruiser as it makes a b-line towards one of your battleships.
You feel like Anakin Skywalker as you fly right up beside the cruiser and start firing at all of the side mounted turrets destroying many, suddenly a nuclear warhead is fired from one of your ships hitting the side of the cruiser causing a bright red flash, you fly away and switch from the fighter pilot to the admiral, through his eyes you see the devastation caused by the nuke.
The red glow is gone with only a slight haze remaining but the massive ship has been essentially split in half, an absolutely devastating blow to Amber's navy, fluently through your alien language you order a full on advance of all of your ships, but while you were focused on the cruiser you hadn't realised that your navy had essentially surrounded Amber's navy.
What's left of Amber's fleet is attempting to retreat but it's no use as it's already surrounded, the retreat turns into a slaughter as your fleet advances on all sides reducing Amber's once great navy into nothing but a debri field for scavengers to loot for hundreds of years, many irreplaceable ships now just empty husks floating in the ocean of fragmented metal.
This is an absolutely crushing defeat for Amber and one she probably won't recover from for many decades, as for you this is a decisive victory and will turn the tide of this war entirely in your favor even though it's only just now started.
The battle of Sedmar is concluded but now begins a likely unopposed invasions of all the rest of Amber's systems.

It is very likely that this was Amber's entire fleet and if so, you should have no trouble steamrolling the rest of her empire but you suddenly remember, this is Amber, she loves a good fight but doesn't take losing (especially on this scale) that well, you just hope she wont break up with you as soon as you stop playing.
1551211212111.title: The Battle of Sedmar

choices: Focus on speed, cloaking and sensors.
Start bringing out the Battle Cruisers and Space Fighters.
1551211212112.content:
No sign of Amber yet, that was a good thing you thought. Being blind to what Amber could be doing could be a bad thing. You could direct the Adronni to focus on learning the science of cloaking, faster travel, and sensors to spot what Amber and her people have been doing.

On the other hand you still haven't really produced an armada. What would be the point of finding Amber if you aren't equip to deal with her?
1551211212112.title: All quiet on the Amber front.

choices: With Venoan backing, you could practically buy Amber's empire.  Venoan Republic.
War is inevitable, and your soldiers aren't particularly good.  Spirathi Kingdom
15512112121121.content:
No tactical disposition is as valuable as knowledge. You can't fight blind, and it might help to see who else inhabits this galaxy.

Adronni laboratories focus on developing powerful, interstellar sensor arrays. At this point in development, communication between your new colonies is extremely slow, but the new sensor technology should help there too. Soon, you have eyes and ears in a growing portion of the Galaxy, but now a new series of choices emerges.

The Adronni sensors have detected several different non-Amber interstellar empires nearby. There was the Venoan Republic; a race of pale-skinned humanoids who specialized in economy, but had a very small holding. They're essentially Space Venice (from Civ V), which means that as the game progresses their economy will make them near untouchable. They could make a good trade partner/ally.

On the other hand, there was the Spirathi Kingdom. A wolf-like race, the Spirathi were the best race when it came to warfare. They were physically the strongest, and had a long-standing warrior tradition that produced not just fierce warriors, but skilled and cunning generals as well. However, they're scientific developments left much to be desired, perhaps they could benefit from your advanced tech? And you could certainly use Spirathi soldiers in the coming war.

The rules of the game make it easier to ally with another empire if you meet them before meeting others. With that in mind, who do you make contact with first?

P.S. The sensors are still looking for Amber and her people, and the scientists are still working on the cloaking array.
15512112121121.title: Focus on speed, cloaking and sensors.

choices: Build Light Ships to Protect Trade
Military Development Right Away
155121121211211.content:
You dispatch diplomatic envoys the Venoan Republic, and already they're eager for a trade deal. Diplomats are also dispatched to the Spirathi Kingdom, but they are less enthusiastic. It will take some careful diplomacy to gain them as an ally.

In the meantime, long-range sensors have picked up a scout ship that seems to be from Amber's Empire. It's a long way out, but it is heading in your direction. At the same time, it could veer-off and make contact with the Spirathi. Your diplomats have spoken ill of Amber to the Spirathi, but there's still a chance of an Amber-Spirathi alliance. The scout ship will need watching.

Domestic matters require your attention. Right now, your economy is ok, but without steady income you can't afford a powerful military. Venoan trade revenue will start coming in soon, but that will take some time and the trade ships face danger in The Black (space.) You could use your modest economy to build a modest number of light ships. This would allow you to offer some protection for the Venoan merchants. On the other hand, you could dip into some deficit funding and start getting a strong military up and running immediately.

As Adronni Prince, the decision is yours.
155121121211211.title: With Venoan backing, you could practically buy ...

choices: He Who Commands the Sea (of Stars) Commands Everything.  Navy
Armies are the Backbone of Militaries.  Army
1551211212112111.content:
Deficit spending is a last resort, frugality now will lead to wealth later.

Your orbital shipyards begin producing light ships. "Light ships" meant vessels in the corvette to frigate range (for reference, ships will use the Anaxes War College System, described here: http://starwars.wikia.com/wiki/Anaxes_Wa... ).

These ships are fast, designed to respond swiftly to any incidents while on convoy escort duty. The ships do their job well, and soon the Adronni economy is ready to field a galactic-scale military. You have sufficient funding to develop both a standing army and navy, but which first? A navy could control the space lanes and prevent Amber from getting close to your worlds. On the other hand, a navy couldn't capture planets. An army could prevent Amber from making good on any conquests she made.

It's your choice. Meanwhile, it's still too early to tell where the scout ship is going, but it definitely is Amber's.
1551211212112111.title: Build Light Ships to Protect Trade

choices: Build the Death Star!
Focus on improving all of your ships, no Death Star, its too costly.
15512112121122.content:
You realize rather or not you find Amber first doesn't matter. What matters is who will win the inevitable clash.

You begin to move the Adronni industry towards ship production. You're going to build a mix of several different type of ships. There were frigates who were small scouting ships that could zip in and out of combat. There were cruisers who were middle sized ships armed with Lasers, Nuclear tipped missiles and armored plating. And of course there were the capital ships, the Destroyers. These ships were massive and expensive but they could take a lot of pounding. They also carried dozens of short range one man fighters.

Each "turn" was bringing multiple ships online. Soon you would have a great armada at your disposal.
Still no sign of Amber but you knew she would be coming for your eventually.

In technology terms you could use to upgrade all of your ships and make them all better in combat or you could choose to devout a huge chuck of your economy to building a "Death Star." It would be even larger then the Destroyer class ships and while it didn't have a planet destroying super weapon it could eventually bomb a planet back to the stone age given enough time.
15512112121122.title: Start bringing out the Battle Cruisers and Spac...

choices: Let's go with big capital ships!
Ummmm... a little bit of everything?
155121122.content:
"We'll start with something simple. We'll have two opposing bases on either end of a space map. You can build the production facilities you would like and then form your armada. We'll meet in the middle and see who the victor is."

You thought this was an interesting game and agreed.

"Oh and loser... has to do whatever the winner wants for an hour. You up for the bet?"

You smile confidently. There was a ton of things you would love to do with Amber... "You got it!"

You look at the interface and see a wealth of options. You could focus on large capital ships. Small fighter ships. A mixture or you could look at specialized ships. Ships that can board others or ships with unique abilities like ones that can strip shields. You had to admit to yourself there seemed to be a crazy amount of complicated options. You were in over your head but your pride demanded that you go for the win.

What strategy do you choose?
155121122.title: Space Wars!  Its ships and building ships and m...

choices: Try to attack the amazons.
Try to find a secret dungeon.
1551212.content:
You immediately found yourself flying over a vast landscape. It appeared to be symmetrical. On each side, there was a large medieval-style building, surrounded by guards. One of the buildings had male knights surrounding it, the others were female. Between them, there was a green field. In it's center, a labyrinth divided the area into two parts. You realized that the walls were so big, they would seem huge even if you were ten times larger. Up north was a snowy mountain range and south, you saw nothing but the vast, blue sea. Looking closer, you spotted a small temple somewhere between a few large rocks at the beach.

After you had observed your surroundings, Amber started explaining the rules. You noticed her wearing tight, brown leather-clothing, boots and gloves. Her hair was tied together to a pony tail. She almost looked like a huntress from a video game, she was only missing bow and arrows. Your eyes also did not fail to miss her cleavage, revealing a portion of her big breasts, squeezed together. "Hey, my eyes are up her!" She smiled girlishly. "Now, do I have your attention?" You nodded, your face reddening. "Fine. The rules of the game are quite simple. It is a roleplaying game. If you defeat enemies, you gain experience and gold. For gold, you can buy items and upgrade your base. If you gain enough experience, you get a level up. To keep things simple, upgrades and levels are represented by size. The higher your level is, the bigger you grow, and the more upgraded you base is, the bigger it will be. Of course, if enemy units are below your level, you will gain less EXP from them. For that reason, there are several hidden shrines. Activating them replaces all the regular enemies with stronger and bigger ones."

Amber then pointed at the two buildings. "Those are our bases. If you die, you will respawn there. To win the game, you have to destroy my base and vise versa. To prevent us from having an early encounter, there is a maze dividing our two lands. And to make things even more interesting, there are some hidden dungeons, containing chests with extra gold and bosses for extra EXP. Of course, killing the other hero will grant you extra gold and EXP as well. So, if you have no further questions, let's begin."

You then appeared at the base with the male knights. Venturing into the fields, you spotted several bandits. You defeated a few of them and eventually, you reached level two. A tingling sensation was flowing through your body as you rose almost a foot higher. More confident then before, you tried to attack the bandits more recklessly. Unfortunately, you quickly overreached yourself as you drew the attention of too many. They quickly surrounded and defeated you.

After a whole minute of waiting, you finally respawned. You cursed over the lost time. Quickly, you walked into the field again when suddenly, the bandits flashed. After the light was gone, you saw in shock that they had been replaced by amazon warriors more than twice your size. Was Amber already that far? You immediately turned around, and checked the merchant at your base for something to help you. Eventually, you decided to buy a scroll that would grant you a basic lightning spell. With that, you could attack the amazons from the distance until you would be strong enough.

But then, another thought came into mind. Maybe Amber activated the shrine early to slow you down, while she was fighting one of the dungeon bosses she had mentioned earlier. That way, she would be able to faster reach the amazons level and then quickly leave you behind. In that case, there must be a boss you should be able to defeat at your level.

Eventually, you chose your next move.
1551212.title: Roleplaying arena

choices: You decide to scout the surrounding area.
Before you could decide, the ground starts to shake.
15512121.content:
Eventually, you decided that you had to gain levels as fast as possible. So you sneaked up to one of the amazons and shot a lighting bolt at her. As it hit her, she was stunned for a moment. However, you quickly realized that the spell did almost no damage. Instead, the woman, who's legs alone were bigger than your whole body, ran towards you. You knew it was just a game, but still, you felt terrified. Turning around, you ran as fast as you could, only to bump into something. To your horror, it was another amazon. Her muscular arms grabbed you and threw you through the air with ease. You then crashed into the chest of your pursuer, who did not even budge upon the impact.

Shortly after, you had to wait another minute to respawn. That was definitely not working. So, you decided to go and search for some hidden treasure to buy better items. After a while, you spotted a small cave. You entered it, but instead of a treasure chest, you found a secret merchant. Looking over his stuff, your eyes were quickly drawn to one particular item, the cloak of invisibility.

You wondered. With that, you could not only sneak through the maze, but you could back attack Amber, which would give you a huge advantage. Fascinated by that idea, you purchased it and set off for the maze.

Wandering through it filled you with awe. The walls were over 150 feet tall and the whole place had an aura of ancient times and mystery. After you turned around another corner, you froze. A giant woman, covered only in a few bandages, walked towards you. She had long, black hair, carried a spear and was almost as tall as the walls. The amazons were nothing compared to her. You started to tremble slightly as you realized the head of her spear was as big aus you were. You guessed she was some sort of guardian, here to prevent you and Amber from meeting too soon. Fortunately, she did not see you thanks to you being invisible. And yet, she was walking in your direction. You pressed yourself against the wall, but when her naked foot slammed into the ground next to you, the impact sent you flying through the air.

After the guardian was gone, you continued. It took you longer than you had hoped, but eventually, you found the exit. Carefully, you stepped into the open. Almost instantly you noticed that there were no amazons. Had Amber already defeated them all. But it did not matter. All you had to do was destroy her base. You marched towards it, but immediately stopped again. The sight before you made you gulp and made your knees shake. Amber's base was huge, the female knights before it were twice the size of the amazons. How should you destroy that?

You pondered. It appeared to you that were quite underleveled. Maybe you should search the area first. With the help of the cloak of invisibility, you should be able to defeat enemies more easily and gain a few levels. Then, you could wait until Amber would leaves for your base and attack while she would be gone.
15512121.title: Underleveled

choices: She finds you
She leaves
155121212.content:
BOOOM
Oh no. What was that.
BOOOM
You look around but see nothing except rocks hopping with every quake.
BOOOM
Maybe you should hide. You quickly dive behind a boulder.
BOOOOOOOOM
Oh my god.
BOOOOOOOOOOOOM!!!!!!!!
You look up and see Amber. She is enournous, too big to even fit in your castle. She quickly scanned the area before her eyes fall on you rock.
155121212.title: Before you could decide, the ground starts to s...

choices: Deeper into the dungeon it gets warmer
Deeper into the dungeon it gets colder
Take the path up and see where it leads
15512122.content:
You needed to catch up on some levels after your early death, so you went searching for a dungeon and hopefully a boss you could defeat for some extra experience.

Exploring the world was amazing, this virtual world seemed so real, the leaves on the trees and the dirt on the ground was just like it would be in real life. You continued to marvel at the world as you wandered through a forest. You saw a few groups of amazons around but you decided to stay on target and search for the entrance to a dungeon.

Sure enough after about thirty minutes of wandering you came across something that could only be described as a dungeon entrance. A stone doorway with vines growing across it, there were runes that you couldn't read chiseled into the stone around the entrance.This was perfect and just what you needed to get ahead against Amber. You used your sword to hack through the vines and ventured down some stairs into the dungeon.

In side was dull but not dark, there seemed to be a luminous moss growing on the walls that made it easier to see so you didn't need to worry about light.

A minute into the dungeon you encountered your first enemy it came towards you in a kind of looping run. It was humanoid only about 4 foot tall but hunched as well so it seemed smaller, it had black leathery skin with small bone protrusions on its arms and shoulders, they weren't sharp more like a primitive form of natural armor. Small horns and sharp claws rounded out the creature.

Roaring a challenge, party because you were excited for the fight, you swung your sword underhanded at imp, it raised one of its arms to block, your sword connected with a satisfying crunch sound. The imp shrieked in pain and snarled at you its arm a bloody mess now. Not wasting any time your brought your sword down over head and finished the wretched creature off. You felt a slight surge as you gained experience, now you felt great about coming into this dungeon.

For the next fifteen minutes us pushed deeper into the dungeon, fighting and destroying more of the imps as you went. Your lightening spell was also an effective way to defeat multiple imps as your'd been able to chain it to three imps at once. You'd gained a few levels and therefore height but the dungeon scale seemed to grow perfectly with you, this suited you because it meant the imps were still worth a good amount of experience.

You found yourself at a crossroads in the dungeon, one path lead deeper and was obviously the way to more powerful enemies. The other branched off upwards and might be a way back to the surface so you can assess how well you have gone against the enemies up there.

Where do you go....
15512122.title: Try to find a secret dungeon.

choices: Announce yourself and attack
Try and sneak around to the other side
Something else...
155121221.content:
Barely hesitating at the crossroads you moved deeper into the dungeon. Your sword ready in your right hand and lightening dancing on the fingertips of your left. You smiled having fun and feeling so cool.

A group of imps charged you, these ones had red runes branded onto their bodies but otherwise were the same as the last ones. Your lightening crackled and illuminated the space with its brilliant light, two the imps exploded, third was decapitated by your blade, you jumped back to dodge the claws of the forth and finished it off by running it through with your sword.

You took a moment to study the runes on the bodies since theses were new. It was the same rune on the two bodies that you hadn't exploded, it was red and definitely looked like it had been seared into the flesh. Whatever the reason these imps gave more experience which was excellent, in fact you leveled up again reaching level 5. You 'learned' a new ability, by learned the knowledge of a new move was added to your brain. Lightening's Vengeance; when you have stabbed an enemy with your sword channel lightening through your blade to deal massive damage to the enemy and everyone in the area.

As you moved deeper into the dungeon you used your new ability to wipe out 5 imps at once gaining you another level. The dungeon was definitely getting hotter then you rounded a corner and found the source of the heat. A lava river was running through the cavern you were looking at, there were some primitive tools and equipment being manned by the imps, it looked like the lava was being diverted in different directions clearly this was some kind of operations base.

What was more interesting was the two females you saw. Both of them had deep red skin, black hair, long black nails. They had large curved horns and wore what looked like medium armor. From your vantage point you could see they only carried whips which they were using to make the imps work harder. The devil women were much taller than the imps, both would be about your size indicating that they were likely much more worthy opponents.

You wondered how best to approach this fight....
155121221.title: Deeper into the dungeon it gets warmer

choices: You win
You lose
You win, but more enemies appear immediately
1551212211.content:
"Hello devils!" you announce boldly as you walk down towers the lava river. You rotate your shoulders and stretch your arms in an overblown display of preparing for a fight. The devils look at you and smile.

"Oh look, new prey to whip into shape, these little mountain imps were too easy to control and our mistress was really hoping someone worthwhile would arrive eventually." The imps looked around nervously clearly unsure what they were meant to be doing.

"Keep working" one of the devils snapped "we'll break this one in now"

With that the two women uncoiled their whips and the battle begun. It was hard to get close to the devils, between them they could keep you at range with their whips and your sword wasn't able to get you close enough. You tried a lightening attack it hit one devil but didn't destroy her but it gave you an opening, you rushed her and took a swing with your sword. she definitely got hit but her armor was able to absorb some of the damage. She smirked at you. You were about to bring your sword down again when you felt something coil around your ankle and pull you over. The second devil had whipped your ankle and pulled you over. Your face connected painfully with the dirt, you could see the black boots of the slaver dominating your vision. You were still a bit dazed when one lifted up and crashed down onto your head.

The devil ground your face into the dirt before she jumped away laughing at you. You quickly got to your feet sweating and dirty there was a devil either side of you now they were cautiously circling you. One devil lashed out and connected her whip painfully with your shoulder, another blow almost hit you in the eye. You charged the full health devil this time, you were seeing red at the frustration of being whipped and having your head stomped on.

Roaring you were about to swing your blade when both your ankles were tried up by the whip of the other devil and you landed flat on your face again. Instead of stomping on your head though the other devil retreated and expertly whipped both your wrists with her whip, you managed to hold onto your sword. Either end of your body was now being controlled by one devil.

"Looks, like he's all tired up" one said to the other. "I think he likes eating dirt" the other retorted

You screamed in frustration as the devils played with you for a minute. They dragged you around the ground and used their skills to lift you up and drop you down causing damaging to your ribs and exposed torso.

"Time to finish you off, you pathetic adventured" the devils started spinning you around between then, like a skipping rope. You were dizzy and disorientated, just when you worry you might throw up get get released and tossed into the air. You lose your grip on your sword, the whole world is spinning, you can't tell up from down, devil laughter is everywhere. You can't afford to die now....
1551212211.title: Announce yourself and attack

choices: Deeper still
Take the way out
Amber appears, following in your footsteps
15512122111.content:
As you fly through the air you see your sword spinning next to you, everything seems to slow down. You have complete focus on one thing, vengeance.....

You reach out and grab the hilt of your sword and angel yourself downwards. The devils below are standing next to each other smiling, but when they see the look of clarity and focus on your face their smiles turn upside down. You smirk, you hold your blade close aiming it at the heart of one of the devils. There was no time to react the devils were screwed, you landed and your blade ran right through one of the devils.

"LIGHTENING VENGEANCE" you screamed as she was completely blow apart and her partner was also destroyed in the explosion.

All the imps in the area were destroyed and you felt a rush of experience flood into you. Then there was peace for a moment. You were sore but there was no permanent damage from your flight.

Looking around you had two paths, one that followed the lava deeper into the dungeon, the second followed the lava a different direction but that way felt like it had a cool breeze coming from it so it might be a way out.
15512122111.title: A moment of clarity

choices: Boss battle
Boss battle
Boss battle
155121221111.content:
Deeper still you drove into the cave. No enemies could stop you now, it seemed that your victory over the devils had given your a significant size advantage. You could step on the mountain imps now and the devil slave masters were nothing to you. You were like a god, a powerful level 15 god by the time you reached the doors to the boss chamber.

They were stone and massive with runes engraved in red on them. They were nothing, you kicked them down with ease and walked into a throne room.

"Welcome, adventurer, I see you have made short work of my minions" there was a devil woman sitting on a raised throne in the room. Rivers of lava ran around the rooms exterior, this room was more to your scale and so was the devil.

The woman was red skinned like the others, black hair that draped to her shoulders, she had massive wings easily capable of flying her around. She also had a thick and long tail that ended with a point in classic devil style. Then she stood up and you realized how little she was wearing. Black knee high boots, a skimpy thong and bra to match. Her skin was glistering in the hot room.

You were immediately distracted by her appearance. She was thick not thin clearly muscular. You tried to focus, cursing yourself you had to win this fight so you could beat Amber.

The devil walked right up to you so confidently, she was exactly the same height as you. Before you could react she was right in front of you and planted a kiss on your lips. You were shocked so she was able to linger kissing you for a moment before you shoved her away.

"What was that!" you exclaim

"I like to taste all my future servants" the devil replied licking her lips

"What do you mean?" you reply still not really thinking straight

"You'll see, ready to get beaten slave" the boss taunted
155121221111.title: Deeper still

choices: Tells you what to go and do
Kills you to send you back out to earn experience for her
Amber arrives
1551212211111.content:
The boss took flight and started circling and round the room, you pivoted on the spot trying to keep up with her. You fired off a salvo of lightening shots some missed some connected, causing the devil to come to ground a few feet away from you. Your rushed her heedless of any strategy. As you approached the devil jumped into the air and used her powerful wings to beat you back. The force of the winds created forced you onto your knees then blew you onto your back.

The devil quickly flew forward and landed on your chest, she was heavy, one boot on your soft abdomen and the other on your sternum. She cast a hauntly figure smiling cruelly as she stood on you. Before you could react she stomped not once but three times on your chest knocking the air out of you, you coughed they where powerful stomps. Next the devil jumped down and straddled you, her body was so warm, you were too distracted as she went in for a kiss. The kiss felt amazing, the damage your just taken seemed to fade away, you felt tingling, it didn't feel good. A warning bell went off in your brain. You checked your level.... level 12 you'd just lost 3 levels.

This snapped you back into reality losing power was one thing you couldn't afford if you lost your levels to this crazy boss you'd never have a hope against Amber.

You powered up a lightening blast, the devil seemed distracted absorbing your power. The blast sent her across the room. You felt rejuvenated but you'd hope so since you'd just lost 3, no 4 levels.

"MMMMMMmmmmm, that was delicious, you know I didn't know who would win with us being even levels after you destroyed my army. But I know I'm going to win now" the boss said smiling

A cold chill went down your spine. No idea how you could get out of this, this was bad.

She didn't give you much time to think the devil rushed you. You raised to your sword but she battered it away with her wings and garbed you in close. Your tried to over power her arms but she was stronger and forced them down to your sides. Smiling she went for a kiss but you pulled away.

"Awwww you think you've got a choice" with that the devil's tail wrapped around your neck and forced you to look at her.

"This part is the most fun for me the" the boss went in for a kiss and you could feel your power draining away. But to your horror your size started going as well. The devil took a breath and smiled she let your arms drop and stood up. You only came up to her waist.

"You look like you still have some levels left to give me"

"NOOOOO" you shot lightening at her but it barely did any damage, given you were down to level 5 again now trying to fight a level 25 boss. The devil laughed, then she grabbed you around the neck with her tail again and started chocking you. Your arms went to the tail and tried to pry it away but it was no use.

In what could only be described as a display of dominance and humiliation the boss proceeded to toy with you for about 15 minutes. First she conjured a mirror so you could watch yourself be destroyed by her, then she picked you up by your neck with her tail and walked towards her throne. You pathetically tried to get breath while she more or less hung you with her massive body. She sat on her throne dominantly and forced you to kneel next to her. In the mirror it was pathetic you were tiny on your knees and were lower than her knees while she sat, you had a fleshy collar around your neck and your face was slowly turning blue as the devil only gave you limited oxygen.

"I like the contrast slave, your face looks good next to my tail"

Next she forced you flat onto your stomach and put a heel on your head. The weight hurt and would be enough to do some serious damage. Again the view in the mirror was pathetic. Next she turned you over and put her boot in your face. "Kiss it" she said, her boot was clean but engraved with the same rune you'd see on the imps. If you could think clearly that might have meant something to you but right now you kissed her boot as instructed. Given you wanted to breath.

You knew it was coming but didn't like it. The boss lifted you up to her face and kissed you again. Finally draining your remaining levels. You had nothing, she even took your lightening spell. You also only came up to just below her knee now standing up. Her tail wrapped around your whole body, the devil squeezed and your screamed.

"What were you thinking being level 1 trying to take on a level 30 boss like me" the boss taunted. "But don't worry I'll put you to work now"

"Fuck you.... bitch" you said gasping

"I was hoping you would be like" the devil said. "I want you to know that as well as being able to drain your powers I have another special ability that combos well with draining powers. I can dominate lesser creatures and make them work for me. And I'd say a level 1 human is a lesser creature" smiling the devil stood and carrying you with her tail she walked over to the lava around the outside of the room. She put her boot it, she didn't burn at all.

"I'm going to brand you with my mark, this means you will work for me and what you do will flow to me. After I do this I will get 30% of all the experience you earn, automatically. You should be more careful before you fight a boss like me. Also I will be your queen after this, you may call me master" the devil started laughing. "I can't believe I've captured a player like this, not in my wildest dreams would I have pulled this off"

You started screaming and swearing for help, but you were still wrapped in her tail. "GrarRyffft" you didn't think it could get worse but the devil stuffed the tip of her tail in your mouth gagging you. You had to wait pathetically moaning as your former enemy turned dominatrix heated up her boot in the lava. When she was ready she squeezed you very tightly and walked back to her throne. You were too weak to move when she dumped you on the ground, she used her tail to arrange your limbs to be spread eagle in front of her seat. "Take one last look at your 'free self'" she taunted you with the mirror. Covered in bruisers and badly beaten you looked pathetic, the size different was laughable, you had just given all your power to this woman and now you were indebted to her for the rest of the game, how could you escape her and beat Amber.

But these thoughts were interrupted when you saw the red hot boot above you with its rune on the bottom ready to brand you. Your new queen stepped onto your chest, her foot covered your whole chest. It burnt, you started screaming but the tail shot into to your mouth to silence you. The pain stopped quickly, you assume you went numb, in the mirror you saw the devil smile and sit on her throne you being helpless under her now. Red energy flowed down her leg into you.

After a few minutes it stopped. She let you up, you had her rune branded into your chest. You were thoroughly defeated.

"Okay Tom I think it's time you start serving your queen."
1551212211111.title: Boss battle

choices: You didn't respawn at your base
Back at base
Back at base under attack
15512122111112.content:
You were silent, there was nothing you could say in this situation. Transformed into the servant of a dungeon boss didn't leave you with many retorts... weren't they supposed to kill you when they won. That would of been better than this.

"What's the matter minion? Nothing to say to your queen" The devil smiled at you, clearly enjoying how uncomfortable you were.

Then all at once your strategic mind kicked back into gear, you still had a game to win and while being this devil's servant wasn't the best you had to beat Amber. "How can I hunt prey without any powers?" You bellowed up towards the queen who towered above you on her throne.

Your queen smiled and stroked her chin, clearly thinking about what you'd said. "You make a good point, I need you to be useful as it benefits me.... here"

Power seemed to surge into your body, the raw power of fire. A number of new abilities became known to you. Flame fists, fireball, ember storm and flame shield. "These are my gifts to you, since you are such a low level you will find these powers... unwieldy and inconsistent. So don't rely on them too much" The queen said smiling. "Also...."

A light armor encased your body it was form fitting and light allowing you to move easily and to your relief covered your branding completely. You flexed your hands enjoying the feeling of your new armor. Maybe this new arrangement wasn't as bad as you had first thought. "One more thing..."

Suddenly your queen stood up, she was intimidating this close. Then she kicked you square in the chest. You were completely shocked and not prepared for the attack, you flew across and the room and to your horror landed in the lava. But it didn't hurt, in fact it was like treading water in mud. You were confused at first but realized your new powers must include lava immunity it made sense considering the devils had it. You pulled yourself out of the lava and looked across the room to see your queen walking across towards you. You also noticed that around the room a number of the slavers you had fought earlier had appeared. They seemed taller, but the fact that you only came up to their hips was just a symptom of your lack of levels.

"Now my servant, I'm starting to tire of you, it is time to send you out of my sight" with that the queen turned and began walking back to her throne. Her hips swaying in an arrogant and over exaggerated manner as she walked away, her dismissive approach to you was enraging. You had nothing to lose you figured.... you attacked your queen.

First you ran then you called upon some of your new powers and took and leap intending to hit her in the middle of her back. As you were half way to her in the air, she glanced over her shoulder a hint of amusement a mixed with pleasure in her eyes. Her damn tail came down from above and connected right into your body, you crashed into the floor then bounced back up in the air a few feet, you didn't recover before her spinning kick sent you flying. You crashed into something hard dazed you looked at your feet, then left, then right all sides had a stone wall. You realized in shock you'd landed on the seat of her throne. Did she plan that, how could you be so easily put in such a humiliating position, this was a game but come on.....

The attack cost you a third of your health and you were still dazed or possibly just sluggish from all the humiliation. You didn't even react as your queen sat down on you. Your whole body was buried under her ass, except your head that was stuck between her legs. She didn't even look at you as she sat, was that how beneath her you now were? She didn't even bother to pay attention while she killed you with her ass while turning you into a throne cushion.

The giantess devil queen started receiving reports from her minions. All was well in her domain, the mountain imps were all branded now and worked tirelessly for her growing army of devil women. This dungeon would be much harder to enter and breach in the future.

If the weight crushing your chest wasn't so great you would of said something.... or maybe asked for mercy. But as it was you were nothing to the Queen. The slow crushing was an agonizing way to die. It took 10 minutes and for the whole time you could do nothing but contemplate how much more powerful this woman was than you. Your last few fevered minutes were of a nightmare where Amber had defeated you in a similar manner..... you couldn't allow that to happen. This was a good learning experience, this world was dangerous and you planned to use this failure to make sure you defeated Amber. Finally you died.....

You woke up on the grass gasping for air..... it was cool the ability to breath was a relief. You stood up and took stock of your surroundings.
15512122111112.title: Kills you to send you back out to earn experien...

choices: Sure, go with it.
Not quite what you meant...
155122.content:
"Well, maybe we could experiment a bit in this VR world." you ask rather timidly.

You were worried Amber might not take the suggestion well, but Amber actually started grinning.

"I was hoping you'd ask that. I know we play strategy games all the time, so I figured we could 'experiment' with some more RPG type games."

"Well..."
155122.title: Tell her that you want to experiment with it fi...

choices: King's Court
Something else
1551221.content:
"Sure, let's do an RPG." you say.

"Great! I've got one ready called King's Court. It's a pretty complex game and it'll take some time to play, but I really think it'll be fun. Or, we have a few others we could try instead."



Which one do you want to play?
1551221.title: Sure, go with it.

choices: Nancy
Jessica
Alice
1552.content:
All of these slots have now been taken. Please use slots #7-9+ if you want to create your own character now.

____________________________________________________________________________ ___________________________________________

She's also an avid D&D player. Dungeons and Dragons is a role-playing game where people role play certain characters such as wizards, knights, assassins and clerics. Ever since you've been with her you've played D&D every weekend.

She takes a strong interest in architecture, building design and the management of cities. She loves the idea of using the simulation to build realistic model cities based on her own imagination as well as real world designs, her personality is shy, somewhat reserved and very analytical. She often runs about and speaks quickly, always dragging you along to her next adventure. You worry just what she might do inside a world that doesn't burden her with physical limits.
